models.description: Convert SEC EDGAR filings, exhibits, and press releases to clean, LLM-ready Markdown. Page-aware. Section-aware. Table-preserving. Built for retrieval and reasoning.

models.name: GPT-OSS

models.name: agentdeck-preview
models.description: AgentDeck is a research platform for studying AI behavior through game scenarios. Run controlled experiments with LLMs, collect comprehensive behavioral data, and replay matches for analysis. üöß Preview release - feedback welcome.

models.name: AI-Prompt-Failure-Diagnosis-Agent
models.description: An intelligent Agentic AI system that analyzes, diagnoses, and improves ineffective prompts used with Large Language Models (LLMs). Instead of merely generating new responses, this agent focuses on understanding why a prompt failed and how to fix it ‚Äî acting as an AI debugging assistant for prompt engineering.

models.name: Continuous-Fine-Tuning-Pipeline-for-LLMs-Airflow-HuggingFace-LoRA-
models.description: A production-grade Self-Improving AI System that continuously fine-tunes a Large Language Model (DeepSeek Coder) on new domain-specific data, evaluates its quality, and automatically deploys it for high-performance inference.

models.name: self_learning_content_moderation
models.description: This project implements an industry-grade toxic / abusive content detection pipeline that goes beyond static machine learning models. The system automatically detects novel (out-of-distribution) language, discovers new open-source datasets, and re-trains itself without human intervention.

models.name: AI-cyber-range
models.description: ‚öîÔ∏è Build, break, and secure Large Language Models with our automated OWASP Top 10 cyber range for hands-on AI security training and research.

models.description: intelligent auditing tool powered by large language models, supporting GPT, . It automatically detects security vulnerabilities, performance issues

models.name: Mobius-LLM-Fine-tuning-Engine
models.description: üîß Fine-tune large language models locally on your data, export to GGUF, and train on CPU with ease using the Mobius LLM Fine-Tuning Engine.

models.name: LLMTradingAgents
models.description: LLMTradingAgents is an automated trading system that orchestrates competition between different Large Language Models (LLMs). It uses a 3-agent architecture to analyze market data, propose trades, and validate risk.

models.name: tinygpt
models.description: ü§ñ Simplify understanding of large language models with TinyGPT, featuring a complete training flow, no GPU needed, and guided learning for developers.

models.name: llm-personalized-news-pipeline
models.description: A Docker-based multi-LLM pipeline that profiles users from free-text input and delivers personalized news processing through chained language models and a lightweight web UI.

models.name: Fake-News-Detection-ML
models.description: Fake News Detection system built using Machine Learning and Natural Language Processing (NLP).  The model classifies news as real or fake using TF-IDF and supervised learning with high accuracy.

models.name: newscope
models.description: This is a Python-based news exploration and summarization application built using Streamlit. It fetches news articles from external APIs, converts them into embeddings, stores them in a vector database, and uses a large language model for retrieval-augmented generation (RAG) based summarization and querying.

models.name: Fake-News-Detecter
models.description: A Machine Learning based web application that detects whether a given news article is REAL or FAKE using Natural Language Processing (NLP) techniques.  The system preprocesses news text, converts it into numerical features using TF-IDF Vectorization, and classifies it using a Logistic Regression model. A simple and interactive Streamlit interface

models.name: new-language-model
models.description: The New Language Model uses context engineering to facilitate bible translation.

models.name: cross-lingual-fake-news-detection
models.description: Analyzing how classical fake news detection models degrade across languages and why multilingual transformers are necessary.

models.name: Fake-News-Detection
models.description: Developed a text classification model to identify misinformation in news articles.  Implemented TF-IDF Vectorizer to transform unstructured text data into numerical features. Demonstrated proficiency in Data Cleaning and Natural Language Processing.

models.name: ABM_TFG_FAUUFRJ
models.description: This essay investigates the insertion of Agent-Based Modelling (ABM) simulation in architectural/landscape design for public spaces, using the logic of desire paths to generate new layouts and alternatives. The work was based on algorithms such as BOIDs and ant foraging and, using the Python programming language in Rhinoceros 3D/Grasshopper.

models.name: fake_news_detection_nlp
models.description: Built an intelligent system to detect fake or misleading news articles using natural language processing and machine learning. The model analyzes the text of news headlines and articles to classify them as real or fake, helping combat misinformation online.

models.name: Space-Transformers-2026
models.description: This code takes the example given in the paper "SpaceTransformers: Language Modeling for Space Systems"  https://ieeexplore.ieee.org/stamp/stamp.jsp?arnumber=9548078  and starts with the source code and domain-specific models are available at github.com/strath-ace/smart-nlp and adds the ability to evaluative models and provides new features.

models.name: NewSpace
models.description: Social interaction between humans and agentic language models

models.name: newsletter_financeira
models.description: Este projeto √© um agente aut√¥nomo que cria e envia uma newsletter financeira di√°ria por e-mail. O agente utiliza um Large Language Model (LLM) para gerar um boletim informativo detalhado, formatado e perspicaz com base nos movimentos do mercado nas √∫ltimas 24 horas.

models.name: News-Driven-Risk-Analytics-Dashboard
models.description: A real-time financial news analytics system that combines Natural Language Processing (NLP) and data visualization to assess how media sentiment impacts market risk. The project automates an end-to-end data pipeline  mirroring workflows used in risk management and traded-risk model monitoring
